page.title: 09Wolverhampton Housing Scheme
page.content: The houses in Low Hill were built in 1936,and by the late 1970's were deteriorating.So the council decided to modernise or demolish them.Those houses being modernised are fitted with modern conveniences such as upstairs toilets, bathrooms and central heating.The tenants also had the choice of altering the layout of the house.While this was being done,occupants had the choice of moving temporarily,moving permanently, or staying put while the work went on around them.If the tenants decide to move temporarily they receive #42.If they stay while modernisation takes place they receive #72.If houses were being demolished,the area would be landscaped for residents to enjoy.The cost of modernising each house is #13000 while the overall cost for the whole project will be about #12 million. (NB: # = pounds)
